elements.description: ELobbyTypePrivate only way to join the lobby is to invite to someone else
elements.name: ELobbyTypePrivate

elements.description: ELobbyTypeFriendsOnly shows for friends or invitees, but not in lobby list
elements.name: ELobbyTypeFriendsOnly

elements.description: ELobbyTypePublic visible for friends and in lobby list
elements.name: ELobbyTypePublic

elements.description: ELobbyTypeInvisible returned by search, but not visible to other friends
elements.name: ELobbyTypeInvisible

elements.description: ELobbyTypePrivateUnique private, unique and does not delete when empty
elements.name: ELobbyTypePrivateUnique

elements.description: Takes AppID of DLC and checks if the user owns the DLC & if the DLC is installed.
elements.name: steam.apps_is_dlc_installed

elements.description: Returns the name of another user. Same rules as GetFriendPersonaState() apply as to whether or not the user knowns the name of the other user note that on first joining a lobby, chat room or game server the local user will not known the name of the other users automatically; that information will arrive asyncronously.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_persona_name

elements.description: Returns the local players name - guaranteed to not be NULL. This is the same name as on the users community profile page. This is stored in UTF-8 format.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_persona_name

elements.description: Gets the status of the current user. Returned as EPersonaState.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_persona_state

elements.description: Friend iteration. Takes a set of EFriendFlags, and returns the number of users the client knows about who meet that criteria. Then GetFriendByIndex() can then be used to return the id's of each of those users.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_count

parameters.doc: Set of friend flags to match friends against.
parameters.name: iFriendFlags

elements.description: Returns the steamID of a user. The returned CSteamID can then be used by all the functions below to access details about the user.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_by_index

parameters.doc: Is a index of range [0, GetFriendCount())
parameters.name: iFriend

parameters.doc: Must be the same value as used in GetFriendCount()
parameters.name: iFriendsFlags

elements.description: Returns the current status of the specified user. This will only be known by the local user if steamIDFriend is in their friends list; on the same game server; in a chat room or lobby; or in a small group with the local user.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_persona_state

parameters.doc: Id of friend
parameters.name: steamIDFriend

elements.description: Get friends steam level.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_steam_level

parameters.doc: Id of friend
parameters.name: steamIDFriend

elements.description: Returns a relationship to a user.
elements.name: steam.friends_get_friend_relationship

parameters.doc: Id of friend
parameters.name: steamIDFriend

elements.description: Activates game overlay to store page for app.
elements.name: steam.friends_activate_game_overlay_to_store

parameters.doc: EOverlayToStoreFlag
parameters.name: flag

elements.description: Activates game overlay web browser directly to the specified URL. Full address with protocol type is required, e.g. http://www.steamgames.com/
elements.name: steam.friends_activate_game_overlay_to_web_page

parameters.doc: EActivateGameOverlayToWebPageMode
parameters.name: mode

elements.description: Sets a Rich Presence key/value for the current user.
elements.name: steam.friends_set_rich_presence

returnvalues.doc: True if the rich presence was set successfully, otherwise False.
returnvalues.name: bool

elements.description: Clears all of the current user's Rich Presence key/values.
elements.name: steam.friends_clear_rich_presence

elements.description: Invites a friend or clan member to the current game using a special invite string. If the target accepts the invite, a GameRichPresenceJoinRequested_t callback is posted containing the connect string.
elements.name: steam.friends_invite_user_to_game

parameters.doc: Id of friend
parameters.name: steamIDFriend

parameters.doc: String
parameters.name: connect

elements.description: Set a listener.
elements.name: steam.set_listener

parameters.doc: Listener function to call
parameters.name: listener

elements.description: Adds a string comparison filter to the next RequestLobbyList call.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_string_filter

elements.description: Adds a numerical comparison filter to the next RequestLobbyList call.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_numerical_filter

elements.description: Sorts the results closest to the specified value.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_near_value_filter

elements.description: Filters to only return lobbies with the specified number of open slots Available.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_filter_slots_available

elements.description: Sets the physical distance for which we should search for lobbies, this is Based on the users IP address and a IP location map on the Steam backed.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_distance_filter

elements.description: Sets the maximum number of lobbies to return. The lower the count the faster It is to download the lobby results & details to the client.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_result_count_filter

elements.description: Unused - Checks the player compatibility based on the frenemy system.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_add_request_lobby_list_compatible_members_filter

elements.description: Get a filtered list of relevant lobbies. Will return results as a LobbyMatchList_t event
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_request_lobby_list

elements.description: Gets the Steam ID of the lobby at the specified index. This should only be called after a LobbyMatchList_t call result is received LobbyMatchList_t.m_nLobbiesMatching
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_by_index

parameters.doc: The index of the lobby to get the Steam ID of, from 0 to
parameters.name: index

elements.description: Create a new matchmaking lobby. Will generate a LobbyCreated_t, LobbyEnter_t and LobbyDataUpdate_t event
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_create_lobby

parameters.doc: The type and visibility of this lobby.
parameters.name: lobby_type

parameters.doc: The maximum number of players that can join this lobby.
parameters.name: max_members

elements.description: Joins an existing lobby. Will generate a LobbyEnter_t event
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_join_lobby

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby to join.
parameters.name: lobby_id

elements.description: Leave a lobby that the user is currently in Leave a lobby that the user is currently in; this will take effect immediately on the client side, other users in the lobby will be notified by a LobbyChatUpdate_t callback.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_leave_lobby

parameters.doc: The lobby to leave
parameters.name: lobby_id

elements.description: Returns the current lobby owner. There always one lobby owner - if the current owner leaves, another user in the lobby will become the owner automatically. It is possible (but rare) to join a lobby just as the owner is leaving, thus entering a lobby with self as the owner. You must be a member of the lobby to access this.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_owner

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby to get the owner of.
parameters.name: lobby_id

elements.description: Changes who the lobby owner is. This can only be set by the owner of the lobby. This will trigger a LobbyDataUpdate_t for all of the users in the lobby, each user should update their local state to reflect the new owner. This is typically accomplished by displaying a crown icon next to the owners name.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_set_lobby_owner

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby to get the owner of.
parameters.name: lobby_id

parameters.doc: The new owner
parameters.name: new_owner

elements.description: Updates what type of lobby this is. This is also set when you create the lobby with CreateLobby. This can only be set by the owner of the lobby.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_set_lobby_type

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby
parameters.name: lobby_id

parameters.doc: The lobby type
parameters.name: type

elements.description: Sets whether or not a lobby is joinable by other players. This always defaults to enabled for a new lobby. If joining is disabled, then no players can join, even if they are a friend or have been invited. Lobbies with joining disabled will not be returned from a lobby search.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_set_lobby_joinable

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby
parameters.name: lobby_id

parameters.doc: Enable or disable allowing users to join this lobby?
parameters.name: joinable

elements.description: Set the maximum number of players that can join the lobby. This is also set when you create the lobby with CreateLobby. This can only be set by the owner of the lobby. can not be above 250.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_set_lobby_member_limit

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby to set the member limit for.
parameters.name: lobby_id

parameters.doc: The maximum number of players allowed in this lobby. This
parameters.name: max_members

elements.description: The current limit on the
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_member_limit

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby to get the member limit of.
parameters.name: lobby_id

elements.description: Gets the number of users in a lobby. This is used for iteration, after calling this then GetLobbyMemberByIndex can be used to get the Steam ID of each person in the lobby. Persona information for other lobby members (name, avatar, etc.) is automatically received and accessible via the ISteamFriends interface. The current user must be in the lobby to retrieve the Steam IDs of other users in that lobby.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_num_lobby_members

parameters.doc: The Steam ID of the lobby to get the owner of.
parameters.name: lobby_id

elements.description: Gets the Steam ID of the lobby member at the given index. You must call matchmaking_get_num_lobby_members before calling this. The current user must be in the lobby to retrieve the Steam IDs of other users in that lobby.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_member_by_index

elements.description: Sets a key/value pair in the lobby metadata
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_set_lobby_data

elements.description: Sets per-user metadata for the local user.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_set_lobby_member_data

elements.description: Get data associated with this lobby.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_data

elements.description: Gets per-user metadata from another player in the specified lobby.
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_member_data

elements.description: Returns the number of metadata keys set on the specified lobby
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_data_count

elements.description: Returns a lobby metadata key/values pair by index
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_data_by_index

elements.description: Broadcasts a chat message to the all the users in the lobby
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_send_lobby_chat_message

elements.description: Get a chat message as specified in a LobbyChatMsg_t callback
elements.name: steam.matchmaking_get_lobby_chat_entry

elements.description: Send message
elements.name: steam.networking_send_message_to_user

parameters.doc: A bitmask of k_nSteamNetworkingSend_xxx options
parameters.name: send_flags

parameters.doc: A routing number you can use to help route message to different systems
parameters.name: remote_channel

elements.description: Receive message
elements.name: steam.networking_receive_messages_on_channel

elements.description: Accept session Call this in response to a SteamNetworkingMessagesSessionRequest_t callback. pending or otherwise. If there is an existing active session, this function will return true, even if it is not pending.
elements.name: steam.networking_accept_session_with_user

returnvalues.doc: Returns false if there is no session with the user
returnvalues.name: boolean

elements.description: Close sesssion Call this when you're done talking to a user to immediately free up resources under-the-hood
elements.name: steam.networking_close_session_with_user

elements.description: Close channel Call this when you're done talking to a user on a specific channel.
elements.name: steam.networking_close_channel_with_user

elements.description: Get connection info Returns information about the latest state of a connection, if any, with the given peer.
elements.name: steam.networking_get_session_connection_info

elements.description: Share a file
elements.name: steam.remote_storage_file_share

parameters.doc: Name of file to share
parameters.name: filename

elements.description: Get number of uploaded files
elements.name: steam.remote_storage_get_file_count

elements.description: Get file information
elements.name: steam.remote_storage_get_file_name_and_size

elements.description: Get storage quota
elements.name: steam.remote_storage_get_quota

elements.description: Creates a new file, writes the bytes to the file, and then closes the file. If the target file already exists, it is overwritten.
elements.name: steam.remote_storage_file_write

parameters.doc: The name of the file to write to.
parameters.name: filename

elements.description: Opens a binary file, reads the contents of the file into a byte array, And then closes the file.
elements.name: steam.remote_storage_file_read

parameters.doc: Name of the file to read from
parameters.name: filename

elements.description: Returns the CSteamID of the account currently logged into the Steam client. A CSteamID is a unique identifier for an account, and used to differentiate users in all parts of the Steamworks API.
elements.name: steam.user_get_steam_id

elements.description: Gets the Steam Level of the user, as shown on their profile.
elements.name: steam.user_get_player_steam_level

elements.description: Trading Card badges data access. If you only have one set of cards, the series will be 1. The user has can have two different badges for a series; the regular (max level 5) and the foil (max level 1).
elements.name: steam.user_get_game_badge_level

elements.description: Returns true if the Steam client current has a live connection to the Steam Servers.
elements.name: steam.user_logged_on

elements.description: Returns true if this users looks like they are behind a NAT device. Only valid once the user has connected to steam .
elements.name: steam.user_is_behind_nat

elements.description: Gets whether the users phone number is verified.
elements.name: steam.user_is_phone_verified

elements.description: Gets whether the users phone number is identifying.
elements.name: steam.user_is_phone_identifying

elements.description: Gets whether the users phone number is awaiting (re)verification.
elements.name: steam.user_is_phone_requiring_verification

elements.description: Gets whether the user has two factor enabled on their account.
elements.name: steam.user_is_two_factor_enabled

elements.description: Get an authentication ticket. Retrieve an authentication ticket to be sent to the entity who wishes to authenticate you.
elements.name: steam.user_get_auth_session_ticket

elements.description: Get user stat as an integer. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetStat
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_stat_int

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to get
parameters.name: id

elements.description: Set user stat. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#SetStat
elements.name: steam.user_stats_set_stat_int

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to set
parameters.name: id

parameters.doc: Number to set
parameters.name: stat

elements.description: Get user stat as a floating point number. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetStat
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_stat_float

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to get
parameters.name: id

elements.description: Set user stat. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#SetStat
elements.name: steam.user_stats_set_stat_float

parameters.doc: Id of the stat to set
parameters.name: id

parameters.doc: Number to set
parameters.name: stat

elements.description: Requests global stats data, which is available for stats marked as "aggregated". This call is asynchronous, with the results returned in GlobalStatsReceived_t. nHistoryDays specifies how many days of day-by-day history to retrieve in addition to the overall totals. The limit is 60. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#RequestGlobalStats
elements.name: steam.user_stats_request_global_stats

elements.description: Store the current data on the server. Will get a callback when set and one callback for every new achievement  If the callback has a result of k_EResultInvalidParam, one or more stats uploaded has been rejected, either because they broke constraints or were out of date. In this case the server sends back updated values. The stats should be re-iterated to keep in sync. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#StoreStats
elements.name: steam.user_stats_store_stats

elements.description: Reset stats. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#ResetAllStats
elements.name: steam.user_stats_reset_all_stats

parameters.doc: True if achievements should be reset as well.
parameters.name: achievements

elements.description: Set achievement. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#SetAchievement
elements.name: steam.user_stats_set_achievement

elements.description: Get achievement. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetAchievement
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement

elements.description: Clear achievement. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#ClearAchievement
elements.name: steam.user_stats_clear_achievement

elements.description: Used for iterating achievements. In general games should not need these functions because they should have a list of existing achievements compiled into them. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetNumAchievements
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_num_achievements

elements.description: Get achievement name iAchievement in [0,GetNumAchievements) Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetAchievementName
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement_name

elements.description: Get general attributes for an achievement. Accepts the following keys * "name" and "desc" for retrieving the localized achievement name and description (returned in UTF8) * "hidden" for retrieving if an achievement is hidden (returns "0" when not hidden, "1" when hidden) https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetAchievementDisplayAttribute
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement_display_attribute

parameters.doc: Either "name", "desc" or "hidden"
parameters.name: key

elements.description: Returns the percentage of users who have achieved the specified achievement. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetAchievementAchievedPercent
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_achievement_achieved_percent

elements.description: Find a leaderboard. Will return leaderboard asynchronously. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#FindLeaderboard
elements.name: steam.user_stats_find_leaderboard

elements.description: Gets a leaderboard by name, it will create it if it's not yet created. This call is asynchronous, with the result returned in a listener callback with event set to LeaderboardFindResult_t. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#FindOrCreateLeaderboard
elements.name: steam.user_stats_find_or_create_leaderboard

parameters.doc: The name of the leaderboard to find or create.
parameters.name: leaderboard_name

parameters.doc: The sort order of the new leaderboard if it's created.
parameters.name: eLeaderboardSortMethod

parameters.doc: The display type (used by the Steam Community web site) of the new leaderboard if it's created.
parameters.name: eLeaderboardDisplayType

elements.description: Get the name of a leaderboard. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetLeaderboardName
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_leaderboard_name

elements.description: Get the total number of entries in a leaderboard, as of the last request. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetLeaderboardEntryCount
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_leaderboard_entry_count

elements.description: Returns the sort method of the leaderboard Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetLeaderboardSortMethod
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_leaderboard_sort_method

elements.description: Returns the display type of a leaderboard handle. Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetLeaderboardDisplayType
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_leaderboard_display_type

elements.description: Asks the Steam back-end for a set of rows in the leaderboard. This call is asynchronous, with the result returned in a listener callback with event set to LeaderboardScoresDownloaded_t. LeaderboardScoresDownloaded_t will contain a handle to pull the results from GetDownloadedLeaderboardEntries(). You can ask for more entries than exist, and it will return as many as do exist. * k_ELeaderboardDataRequestGlobal requests rows in the leaderboard from the full table, with nRangeStart & nRangeEnd in the range [1, TotalEntries] * k_ELeaderboardDataRequestGlobalAroundUser requests rows around the current user, nRangeStart being negate e.g. DownloadLeaderboardEntries( hLeaderboard, k_ELeaderboardDataRequestGlobalAroundUser, -3, 3 ) will return 7 rows, 3 before the user, 3 after * k_ELeaderboardDataRequestFriends requests all the rows for friends of the current user https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#DownloadLeaderboardEntries
elements.name: steam.user_stats_download_leaderboard_entries

elements.description: Returns data about a single leaderboard entry Https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#GetDownloadedLeaderboardEntry
elements.name: steam.user_stats_get_downloaded_leaderboard_entry

parameters.doc: Leaderboard entries handle
parameters.name: hSteamLeaderboardEntries

parameters.doc: Which entry to get
parameters.name: index

elements.description: Uploads a user score to a specified leaderboard. This call is asynchronous, with the result returned in a listener callback with event set to LeaderboardScoreUploaded_t. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/api/ISteamUserStats#UploadLeaderboardScore
elements.name: steam.user_stats_upload_leaderboard_score
